segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in his life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks so wobbly, like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, balancing on his tiptoes, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the tension in the air, like something bad is about to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing nearby, waiting for her share, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before, sneaking cookies when no one’s looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a disaster waiting to happen, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pit in my stomach watching them, hoping they don’t fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, clueless about the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks on the outside, while inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
